column4: does anyone have a command or app that cleans ubuntu's memory? (and yes it actually is neccessary, and really is a problem)
umm...reboot? that clears your memory
why should i reboot every time my machine's ram flls up and my system sows down, thats not a solution.
close whatever's using the memory?
rebooting is the only thing that will totally blank all the memory though
i did that. the memory is still filled.
you mean it refilled because you opened a bunch of large apps again?
have you considered that you simply need more memory if you want to run that many large applications?
for example, i simply could not get by on 512MB of RAM, since Firefox requires at least 600
i only run one of those at a time, never more than one at a time.
thats the other ting, io have 4 gigs of ram
are you remembering to subtract the cached mem from the used total?
did you use gdm to login? cuz then ctrl+alt+f1  "sudo service gdm restart" would do it
thank you man!
restarting the display manager didnt work?
no, it actually helped with something else, but no.
what happened when you restarted gdm? it didnt give you a login screen back?
because i am a man who doesn't fear being hacked, i have it set to auto login.
oooooooh
hmm wonder where you can set what the default login session is for a user...
try it in a VM and come back and tell us if it worked, hey?
but if you try it on your real system, you're gonna be crying
